required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BK Virus in Salivary Gland Disease: Treating the Potential Etiologic Agent
clinical_study.official_title: BK Virus in Salivary Gland Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Dental and Craniofacial Research (NIDCR)

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to analyze BK viral infection in salivary gland diseases; specifically, to determine a definitive relationship between BK Virus and HIV associated salivary gland disease (HIVSGD). Participants are adults HIV+SGD+ who will be randomized 1:1 to receive BK Virus antiviral (ciprofloxacin) or placebo for 28 days. Salivary function/protein secretion will be correlated with BK polyomavirus titers. It is expected that patients with HIV+SGD+ will have elevated oral BK polyomavirus viral loads and will benefit from Ciprofloxacin.

detailed_description.textblock: The study duration is 12 weeks with a baseline visit, a visit at 4 weeks and a visit at 12 weeks. At baseline participants are randomized to Ciprofloxacin or placebo and take the drug or placebo for 28 days. At subsequent visits BK polyomavirus presence and salivary gland function will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: BK Viral Status in Saliva at Week 4
primary_outcome.description: Oral fluids will be assessed for evidence of BK Virus replication to determine whether Cipro administration inhibits BK Virus replication in participants with HIVSGD. Oral fluids will be assessed by real-time PCR to determine BK Virus status as positive or negative.

primary_outcome.measure: BK Viral Status in Saliva at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Oral fluids will be assessed for evidence of BK Virus replication to determine whether Cipro administration inhibits BK Virus replication in participants with HIVSGD. Oral fluids will be assessed by real-time PCR to determine BK Virus status as positive or negative.

secondary_outcome.measure: Unstimulated Salivary Flow Rate at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: To determine whether salivary gland function is improved or restored with the administration of Cipro in participants with HIVSGD. After sitting at rest for 1 minute, participants collect drool using 50-mL conical tubes. The 5-minute unstimulated whole saliva flow rate recorded and collected. Salivary hypofunction is defined as unstimulated whole saliva flow rate ≤ 0.1 mL/min. Normal salivary function is defined as > 0.1 mL/min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Unstimulated Salivary Flow Rate at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: To determine whether salivary gland function is improved or restored with the administration of Cipro in participants with HIVSGD. After sitting at rest for 1 minute, participants collect drool using 50-mL conical tubes. The 5-minute unstimulated whole saliva flow rate recorded and collected. Salivary hypofunction is defined as unstimulated whole saliva flow rate ≤0.1 mL/min. Normal salivary function is defined as >0.1 mL/min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Dry Mouth "Yes/No" at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were asked "Have you noticed any change in your salivary glands or in the dryness of your mouth"

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Dry Mouth "Yes/No" at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were asked "Have you noticed any change in your salivary glands or in the dryness of your mouth"

arm_group.description: Active treatment twice daily for 28 days
Placebo treatment twice daily for 28 days

intervention.description: Over encapsulated Ciprofloxacin 500 mg will be taken twice daily for 28 days.
Placebo will over encapsulated to match active treatment, taken twice daily for 28 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV positive with Salivary Gland Disease
- Ability to read and understand English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to the family of fluoroquinolones (including ciprofloxacin)
- Currently taking tizanidine
- Concurrently taking antiacids containing magnesium hydroxide or aluminum hydroxide
- Current use of Theophylline
- Previous tendon disorder such as Rheumatoid arthritis
- History of seizures
- Current use of phenytoin
- Current use of glyburide
- Current use of methotrexate
- Severe renal impairment (known creatinine clearance < 30 or on dialysis)

group.title: Ciprofloxacin
group.description: Active treatment twice daily for 28 days Ciprofloxacin: Over encapsulated Ciprofloxacin 500 mg will be taken twice daily for 28 days.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo treatment twice daily for 28 days Placebo: Placebo will over encapsulated to match active treatment, taken twice daily for 28 days.

measure.title: BK Virus Status in Saliva
measure.description: Oral fluids will be assessed for evidence of BK Virus replication to determine whether Cipro administration inhibits BK Virus replication in participants with HIV associated salivary gland disease (HIVSGD). Oral fluids will be assessed by real-time polymerase chain reaction (PCR) to determine BK Virus status as positive or negative.
measure.population: Data were not analyzed for one participant who discontinued

measure.title: Unstimulated Salivary Flow Rate
measure.description: To determine salivary gland function at Baseline. After sitting at rest for 1 minute, participants collect drool using 50-mL conical tubes. The 5-minute unstimulated whole saliva flow rate recorded and collected. Salivary hypofunction is defined as unstimulated whole saliva flow rate ≤ 0.1 mL/min. Normal salivary function is defined as > 0.1 mL/min.
measure.population: Data not collected because participant missed scheduled visit

outcome.title: BK Viral Status in Saliva at Week 4
outcome.description: Oral fluids will be assessed for evidence of BK Virus replication to determine whether Cipro administration inhibits BK Virus replication in participants with HIVSGD. Oral fluids will be assessed by real-time PCR to determine BK Virus status as positive or negative.
outcome.population: Two participants withdrew prior to Week 4

outcome.title: Unstimulated Salivary Flow Rate at Week 4
outcome.description: To determine whether salivary gland function is improved or restored with the administration of Cipro in participants with HIVSGD. After sitting at rest for 1 minute, participants collect drool using 50-mL conical tubes. The 5-minute unstimulated whole saliva flow rate recorded and collected. Salivary hypofunction is defined as unstimulated whole saliva flow rate ≤ 0.1 mL/min. Normal salivary function is defined as > 0.1 mL/min.
outcome.population: Two participants withdrew prior to Week 4 and one participant did not perform salivary flow collection.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
